7 - (predictive) Model deployment

Source: vignettes/h_model_deployment.Rmd
h_model_deployment.Rmd

Introduction

This section is in progress. bllflow use the Model Specification Workbook to provide instructions to generate:

  • the PMML file that described how to calculate predictive algorithms.
  • validation (testing) data.
  • calibratin data.
library(survival) # for pbc data
data(pbc)
library(bllflow)
#> Loading required package: tableone
#> Loading required package: DDIwR
#> Loading required package: xml2
pbcDDI <- ReadDDI(file.path(getwd(), "../inst/extdata"), "pbcDDI.xml")
variables <- read.csv(file.path(getwd(), '../inst/extdata/PBC-variables.csv'))
variableDetails <- read.csv(file.path(getwd(), '../inst/extdata/PBC-variableDetails.csv'))

# create a BLLFlow object and add labels.
pbcModel <- BLLFlow(pbc, variables, variableDetails, pbcDDI)
WriteDDIPopulatedMSW(pbcModel, "../inst/extdata/", "newMSWvariableDetails1.csv")

See the following examples of how bllflow is used to report and deploy models.

  • Algorithms for indivdual use at Project Big Life
  • Application Program Interface (API)
  • Algorithm deployment for population planning - Coming September 2019.
